metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11945 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Squid before 5.0.2. A remote attacker can replay a sniffed Digest Authentication nonce to gain access to resources that are otherwise forbidden. This occurs because the attacker can overflow the nonce reference counter (a short integer). Remote code execution may occur if the pooled token credentials are freed (instead of replayed as valid credentials).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6').
